The Pulwama terror attack was so deadly that not only it killed over 44 CRPF soldiers but also has left the entire nation fighting among our own-selves.
After Navjot Singh Sidhu’s controversial remark on the terrorist attack, hashtags #BoycottSidhu, #BoycottKapilSharmaShow and #BoycottSonyTV were trending on Twitter.
“For a handful of people, can you blame the entire nation and can you blame an individual?,” Sidhu had said earlier adding, “It (the attack) is a cowardly act and I condemn it firmly. Violence is always condemnable and those who did it must be punished.”
It was reported that Navjot Singh Sidhu has been sacked for the Kapil Sharma Show. Finally, the comedian Kapil himself has broken silence on the entire hoopla. In a video, which was shared by Navjot Singh Sidhu, Kapil can be seen clarifying the reports stating that he has not been ousted from the show.

“There should be a permanent solution to this problem. If sacking Sidhu Ji was a solution, then Sidhu Ji is smart enough to walk out of the show himself. So, people are being misled with hashtags like ‘#BoycottSidhu’ and ‘#BoycottKapilSharmaShow’. Right now one should focus on the genuine problem and the attention of the youth should not be taken away from the real issue,” he said.
“It’s all propaganda that keeps on running on Twitter and I don’t get involved in such things. I have started doing some good things and I want all of you to support me in this instead of creating controversies around my comments.” He added that Archana Puran Singh shot a few episodes with the team of his show because Sidhu Ji had some prior commitments.
Twitter
After his comment received backlash and became controversial, Navjot Singh Sidhu had clarified his stance saying that his remark was “distorted” and that “Mere liye hamesha hi desh pehle tha (For me the country had always been first)…”. At the same time, he said, “but I stand by what I said yesterday (Friday) and I cannot blame an entire nation for an act done by a few cowards.”
title: Kapil Sharma Reacts To Navjot Singh Sidhu's Controversy, Clarifies He Hasn’t Been Sacked From The Show
